definition: to lose/to leave behind/to omit/to bequeath/sth lost/involuntary discharge (of urine etc)

sentences.english: Bessler's widow offers his possessions to the state.
sentences.chinese: 消防队员的遗孀提供自己的财产交给国家。

sentences.english: The widow of the murdered man begged (or urged ) that there ( should ) be no reprisals .
sentences.chinese: 那个被谋杀者的遗孀请求不要有报复行为。

sentences.english: His inconsolable widow continued to keep the wine-shop.
sentences.chinese: 他的遗孀，得不到一点安慰，继续开着那店铺。

sentences.english: I happened to get acquainted with the widow of some departed high Anglo-Indian official.
sentences.chinese: 我偶然结识了一个高级英裔印度官员的遗孀。

sentences.english: Kathleen Pastorius is the widow of that brother, whose name was Ed.
sentences.chinese: 哥哥命叫艾德，凯瑟琳正是他的遗孀。

sentences.english: Wang has a surviving widow, with whom he had no children.
sentences.chinese: 王留有一名遗孀，王与她没有孩子。

sentences.english: A queen dowager who is mother of the reigning sovereign.
sentences.chinese: 在位君主的母亲，先王的遗孀。

sentences.english: And now his widow owned his clues.
sentences.chinese: 现在他的遗孀掌握了他的线索。

sentences.english: She has traveledto Europe and to Hawaii with other firefighters’ widows.
sentences.chinese: 她跟其他几位消防员的遗孀一起去欧洲和夏威夷旅行。

sentences.english: Mr Mujuru's widow is the country's vice-president;
sentences.chinese: 穆菊茹的遗孀是这个国家的副总统。

sentences.english: Mr. Deng's widow, Ms. Qin, said she is worried about the future.
sentences.chinese: 邓宇健的遗孀秦可表示她对未来感到担忧。

sentences.english: Lennon's widow, Yoko Ono, is expected to mark the anniversary day in Iceland.
sentences.chinese: 列侬的遗孀大野洋子将在冰岛庆祝这一天。

sentences.english: Constantine's widow married Romanos and he was proclaimed emperor.
sentences.chinese: 君士坦丁的遗孀嫁给了罗曼努斯，他被宣布为皇帝。

definition: Zhangzi county in Shanxi 山西[Shan1 xi1]
to die/to depart this life (euphemism)/same as 去世
